thread.title: Marcus Rashford stalling Manchester United contract talks over lack of game time? Tuesday's transfer gossip
thread.title_full: Marcus Rashford stalling Manchester United contract talks over lack of game time? Tuesday's transfer gossip

author: Football Spy
title: Marcus Rashford stalling Manchester United contract talks over lack of game time? Tuesday's transfer gossip
text:
Marcus Rashford stalling Manchester United contract talks over lack of game time? Tuesday's transfer gossip PLUS: Manchester United, Arsenal, Liverpool AND Chelsea all want Andrea Belotti Share Marcus Rashford could be considering his options over a lack of game time (Photo: Tom Purslow) Share Get football   Thank you for subscribing!   
Marcus Rashford is stalling talks over a new Manchester United contract due to a lack of playing time. 
According to The Times , the young England striker isn't happy with the lack of opportunities under Jose Mourinho and is considering his options. 
It is claimed that the 19-year-old is not confident of getting an extended run in the first team under the Portuguese boss. 
Rashford has started just two of United's last 12 Premier League games. Rashford has only started two of Manchester United's last 12 Premier League games (Photo: REUTERS) Tuesday's transfer stories from the Mirror 
EXCLUSIVE - Tottenham are tracking Anthony Martial’s uncertain situation at Manchester United . Spurs are aware the France forward is not a regular under new manager Jose Mourinho and could offer him an escape in the summer. 
Arsenal and Manchester United are in talks to sign versatile Monaco star Fabinho - although the player himself favours a move to Manchester City, according to his father. Tottenham are tracking Anthony Martial's situation at Manchester United (Photo: Action Images via Reuters) 
Spurs will have to pay £5milllion to sign back-up keeper Pau Lopez on a permanent basis . Lopez is on a season-long loan from Spain's Espanyol and highly-rated by manager Mauricio Pochettino, but is yet to make a first-team outing. Other news stories from Tuesday's Mirror David Ospina will play against Bayern Munich on Wednesday (Photo: Arsenal FC/Getty Images) 
Arsenal reserve goalkeeper David Ospina will play in Wednesday’s crunch Champions League game away to Bayern Munich . Gunners boss Arsene Wenger has decided to stick to his policy of playing Ospina in Europe, even though Petr Cech is the only Champions League winner at the club. 
AFC Wimbledon chief executive Erik Samuelson has admitted club’s fans have “damaged’ their reputation after shameful scenes marred their weekend clash with Charlton. 
Jordan Pickford has declared himself “ready to play” , handing David Moyes a huge boost. The 22-year-old Sunderland goalkeeper has been out since straining cruciate knee ligaments in Sunderland 's Boxing Day defeat away to Manchester United but hopes to be back when the visit Everton a week on Saturday. Jordan Pickford has handed David Moyes a boost (Photo: Sunderland AFC via Getty) News stories from other newspapers and websites 
Manchester United have ramped up their interest in Andrea Belotti, who is also a target for Arsenal, Liverpool and Chelsea ( Daily Star ) 
Inter Milan have met with Ricardo Rodriguez's agent over a potential £20million signing ( Football Italia ) poll loading Who will win the Golden Boot this season? 1000+ VOTES SO FAR
